entry.title: Guild Wars 2 "The Experience so far"
entry.summary: Guild wars 2 has been a long and winding experience for me ever since I first played it. Its was a breath of fresh air after struggling to find a decent MMO in today's market. It delivers a different approach in most MMOs as its main selling point is the …
entry.content: Guild wars 2 has been a long and winding experience for me ever since I first played it. Its was a breath of fresh air after struggling to find a decent MMO in today's market. It delivers a different approach in most MMOs as its main selling point is the living world.

entry.title: MMORPGs
entry.summary: Massively Multiplayer Online Games or MMORPGs ring a special tune to me in which brings out my childhood memories of waking up early just to login into my game and get a head start. Each level, gear and new zone hits my dopamine levels like a crack addict. There's just …
entry.content:
Massively Multiplayer Online Games or MMORPGs ring a special tune to me in which brings out my childhood memories of waking up early just to login into my game and get a head start. Each level, gear and new zone hits my dopamine levels like a crack addict. There's just something about it that makes me want to keep playing and say "ok, what next?"

I've always had a fascination with MMORPGs that immerses you into the unknown multiplayer world and leaves you to discover its riches alone or with your friends. The infinite possiblities of where you can go and progress is limitless to become whatever you want to be. It is a virtual representation of yourself, your decisions that make your character.

It might just be the dopamine that hits me when i get an upgrade, or the world bosses that requires teamwork to overcome or even just the exploring in which the game immerses me into the world that they had built.

This text is italic This text is also italic

entry.content:
Basic markdown examples are shown below

This text is bold This text is also bold

This text is italic This text is also italic

This text is italic and bold

An h1 heading

An h2 heading

An h3 heading...

An h6 heading

A list with numbers: 1. One 2. Two 3. Three

A list with bullets: * Bullet * Bullet * Bullet

Here's a blockquote:

> Simple is better than complex

Here's a table:

Column1 Column 2 Column 3
Value 1 Value 2 Value 3
Value 4 Value 5 Value 6
Value 7 Value 8 Value 9

entry.title: Markdown Examples Part 2
entry.summary:
Images can be displayed in Markdown.
Text within the square brackets is the image name. The path to the image goes between the round brackets.
The {static} tag indicates the image is stored in the content folder. This setting can be changed in pelicanconf.py.

Links to downloadable content such …
entry.content:
Images can be displayed in Markdown.
Text within the square brackets is the image name. The path to the image goes between the round brackets.
The {static} tag indicates the image is stored in the content folder. This setting can be changed in pelicanconf.py.

Links to downloadable content such as PDF files are written similarly to image files but with no ! symbol at the beginning.

Pelican Documenation

A link to a different blog post on our website is written exactly the same.
Text within the square brackets can be clicked on to travel to the website between the curly brackets. The {filename} tag indicates we want to follow the link to a webpage rather than the static file it was generated from.

First Post

Or we can link to another external website by supplying the web address.

Python Package Index

entry.title: Markdown Examples Part 3
entry.summary:
Code blocks are preceeded by an indent, three : symbols and the name of the language.
All of the following code will be highlighted while the text is indented.

def do_twice(func):
def wrapper_do_twice(*args, **kwargs):
    return func(*args, **kwargs).lower()
return wrapper_do_twice

@do_twice
def say_whee(some_text):
    print(some_text)

x = 'Whee …
entry.content:
Code blocks are preceeded by an indent, three : symbols and the name of the language.
All of the following code will be highlighted while the text is indented.

def do_twice(func):
def wrapper_do_twice(*args, **kwargs):
    return func(*args, **kwargs).lower()
return wrapper_do_twice

@do_twice
def say_whee(some_text):
    print(some_text)

x = 'Whee!'
say_whee(x)
